page.title: 05CHANGE DOWNDERRY/SEATON
page.content: Since 1945 the electoral register of Downderry has increased by 39% from 490 to 683. Most of this increase has been caused by the development of private estates, on the hillsides of Trerieve and Bottlegate and the clifftop region at Camps bay comprising now 48,20 and 15 houses respectively.Similar expansion is seen in the provision of local authority housing from 6 to 26. In Seaton there has been development on both sides of the river .In particular the former market garden of the Heath family is replaced by the Keveral Gardens Estate of 25 houses. Services in the community have not increased.Forty years ago there was an undertaker,a cobbler,a hardware store, a baker,a dispensing chemist.A doctor, a dentist,a postman were resident in in the village .All have gone.
